New Records: Stephen Curry had 27 points and 9 assists, including a game-sealing 3-pointer to Buddy Hield.
Key Match Events: Stephen Curry delivered a suffocating defensive performance, corralling one of the league's most potent offenses.
The Warriors' uptempo offense, applying transition pressure, led to a 118-112 win over the Celtics.
Buddy Hield's game-sealing 3-pointer came after a pass from Stephen Curry.
Stephen Curry's 27 points and 9 assists led the Warriors to a big win over the Celtics.
Pre-Game Insights: The Warriors' defensive aggression, ball movement, motion, and depth make them viable.
Coach Steve Kerr emphasized the importance of strong perimeter defense.
The duel between Stephen Curry and the Celtics' defense was highlighted as the key matchup.
Post-Match Reflections: Stephen Curry expressed pride in his team's effort after the win.
The Warriors' coach highlighted the victory as a crucial step toward the championship.
The team's hunger and commitment to their playing style were praised.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors' new staple - perimeter ball pressure - was effective in applying transition pressure.
The team's depth allowed Stephen Curry to be fresh enough to play both ends with focus and relentlessness.
The Warriors' ability to play both ends of the court with a prominent quarterback was noted.
Others: The article mentions that the Celtics helped the Warriors prove their viability in a big test, and that the Warriors' start to the season lacked the gravitas of a big win until this game.
